bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 114 (Tuesday, July 9, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FORTENBERRY:H.R. 3651.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority for this bill is pursuant toArticle I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H5304]

item.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 515.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 116-630.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 116-630.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Discharged.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
This bill authorizes the Missouri River Basin Lewis and Clark Interpretive Trail and Visitor Center Foundation to use, or enter into a lease or agreement to use for public outdoor recreation, up to 40 acres of the land in Nebraska City, Nebraska, that was conveyed for use as an historic site and an interpretive center for the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail under conditions that

  • the land shall continue to be maintained in a manner compatible with the use of the conveyed land as an historic site and interpretive center,
  • the nature trail around the perimeter of the land shall remain in place and may be enhanced with educational signage about the flora and fauna that are native to the land and the planting of native flora, and
  • revenue from any use of the land for public outdoor recreation shall be used to offset maintenance and operating costs of the interpretive center.

This bill authorizes the Missouri River Basin Lewis and Clark Interpretive Trail and Visitor Center Foundation to use, or enter into a lease or agreement with another party to use for public outdoor recreation, up to 40 acres of the land in Nebraska City, Nebraska, that was conveyed for use as an historic site and an interpretive center for the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail under conditions that

  • the land shall continue to be maintained in a manner compatible with the use of the conveyed land as an historic site and interpretive center,
  • the nature trail around the perimeter of the land shall remain in place and may be enhanced with educational signage about the flora and fauna that are native to the land and the planting of native flora, and
  • revenue from any use of the land for public outdoor recreation shall be used to offset maintenance and operating costs of the interpretive center.

bill.title: To facilitate the use of certain land in Nebraska for public outdoor recreational opportunities, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
